src.java.invertedIndex

Interface IndexWriter

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CSVIndexWriter

    public interface IndexWriter
    An entity that writes an Index on disk with a format depending on the implementation.
    Since:
    10-16-2017

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void saveIndexToFile(java.lang.String fileName, Index invertedIndex, java.lang.String tokenizerType)
      The implementation of this function should write in the first line of the file an header that only contains a tag that identifies the Tokenizer that was used to create the @param invertedIndex.

    • Method Detail

      • saveIndexToFile

        void saveIndexToFile(java.lang.String fileName,
                     Index invertedIndex,
                     java.lang.String tokenizerType)
        The implementation of this function should write in the first line of the file an header that only contains a tag that identifies the Tokenizer that was used to create the @param invertedIndex. After that, the @param invertedIndex itself should be written.
        Parameters:
        fileName - The of the file where the invertedIndex will be written.
        invertedIndex - The Index object to be written on disk.
        tokenizerType - A tag that represents the type of Tokenizer that was used in the indexation process. This tags are located in Constants.
